page.title: 07LANDSCAPE-BARNOLDSWICK
page.content: Our block includes half of the town of Barnoldswick and some picturesque countryside surrounding it. If you looked at our block probaly you would notice Weets hill first because it is quite high and is in the middle of our area. Weets has quite a lot of rough grass and heather growing on it. On the top of Weets there are few trees and it is quite desolate. There are not so many cultivated fields. Many dry-stone walls divide the land here. Below the hill the fields are divided by wire fences,stone walls and hedges. The hedges comprise many varieties of bushes and trees,especially Hawthorn, Sycamore,Ash,Beech and Horse-chestnut. The land is gently rolling pasture dotted with many farms and criss-crossed with public footpaths.
